newsitem.title: UK: Courtaulds in talks with Lenzing on patents.
newsitem.headline: Courtaulds in talks with Lenzing on patents.

text.p: UK chemicals group Courtaulds Plc said on Monday it is in settlement discussions with Austrian fibres producer Lenzing AG over the cross licensing of their patent portfolios.
"These discussions have now reached an advanced stage," the company said in a statement.
The two companies have filed numerous patent applications over their respective Lyocell technologies, many of which have already been granted.
Earlier, Lenzing said that a U.S. court in Washington had decided in its favour in its Lyocell patent dispute with Courtaulds and confirmed Lenzing's patent in the United States.
The Federal Court of Appeal reversed a summary decision by the New York District Court in November 1995 which ruled the patent invalid for not disclosing the "best mode" of invention.
Lenzing claimed infringement of the patent by Courtaulds at its Lyocell plant in Mobile, Alabama, while Courtaulds denied the infringements and asserted that the patent was invalid.
The patent, confined to the United States, is in respect of one process step in the manufacture of lyocell fibre.
"This decision should be kept in perspective," said David Wilkinson, Courtaulds director responsible for fibres.

"Lyocell fibre has huge potential and both companies are working towards a final settlement of their differences which will in future allow them to concentrate their energies on developing Lyocell's market potential to the full".
